poem:
### The Fall of Bayesian

In Sicilian swell,
amid stars, aluminum reaches high,
luxury laid bare—
the world-spanned crew, laughter
woven with sea-salt,
felt the unseen lunge—
a tumult swayed
unexpecting hearts,
harmony shattered—
now, night sings the tale,
etched in waves' lament.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We didn’t see it coming’: the tumultuous Sicilian night that took down the Bayesian The 12 holidaying passengers had come from the UK, the US, Canada, New Zealand and Ireland, occupying six luxurious suites of Bayesian, a 56-metre-long superyacht boasting the tallest aluminium mast in the world. Among the 10 crew members were people from Sri Lanka. The award-winning, British-flagged vessel, which was built in 2008 by the Italian shipbuilder Perini and managed by Camper". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
